law.catch_line: The presumption that an employer-employee relationship exists under § 3-903(c)(1) of this subtitle ...
law.text:
The presumption that an employer-employee relationship exists under § 3-903(c)(1) of this subtitle does not apply if:
an employer produces for inspection by the Commissioner:
a written contract, signed by the employer and business entity, that:
describes the nature of the work to be performed by the business entity;
describes the remuneration to be paid for the work performed by the business entity; and
includes an acknowledgment by the business entity of the business entity's obligations under this article to:
an affidavit signed by the business entity indicating that the business entity is an independent contractor who is available to work for other business entities;
a current certificate of status of the business entity, issued by the State Department of Assessments and Taxation, indicating that the business entity is in good standing; and
proof that the business entity holds all occupational licenses required by State and local authorities for the work performed; and
the employer provided to each individual classified as an independent contractor or exempt person a written notice under § 3-914 of this subtitle.
